headline.main: Treating Youngsters and Easing Parents’ Minds
headline.print_headline: Treating Youngsters and Easing Parents’ Minds

docs.lead_paragraph: AT recess, dozens of children tumble into the nurse's office, jackets askew, some with tear-streaked cheeks, fresh from falls and scrapes on the playground at the Thomas A. Edison School. ''Jason threw me a rock on my head,'' Michael Loja, a 5-year-old kindergartner, said as he sat holding an icepack to his forehead. ''It hurt and it bled.''

headline.main: Treating Youngsters and Easing Parents' Minds
